title: CONNECTING ARABIC TO LATIN SCRIPT
content: To continue discussions started on the Atypi list recently.
author: Saad Abulhab

comments.content:
First, disconnect it -or keep it disconnected- from  
affectations such as chirography and Modernism.

--

Work towards symbiosis, not mutual parasitism.

hhp

Dear Hrant

I had to run to the dictionary (as usual) to help me understand you post :)

I thought I knew what "chirography" means after I was introduced to it (and Bouma) by you and John few years ago. After the past days of discussions on Atypi list, I am at lost. Please redefine it so I can connect (or disconnect) to it. While you are their can you explain "symbiosis" and "parasitism". I told you I am a simple guy :)

-Saad

Mr. Saad Abulhab, by any chance, did you attend :  
 [http://www.kitabat.org/kitabat\_speakers.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415113709/http:/www.kitabat.org/kitabat_speakers.html "http://www.kitabat.org/kitabat\_speakers.html")

Dear Alessadro

Unfortunately I did not. But I am familiar with it. Traveling from New York to Dubai is a big project. But I would love to attend other forums to discuss non traditional Arabic typography one of these days.

-Saad

Saad, I'm getting ready for a trip, and will  
try to once again define " [chirography](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415113709/http:/typophile.com/wiki/chirography)" after  
I get back. "Symbiosis" and "mutual parasitism"  
however are standard terms in biology: the study  
of living things (which to me can pertain to scripts).

--

BTW, we're STILL waiting for the competition results from Kitabat.
